resource.description: The NCBI Taxonomy database contains the names of all organisms that are represented in the Entrez genetic databases.

The Sequence Ontology Project (SO) is a joint effort by genome annotation centres, including: WormBase, the Berkeley Drosophila Genome Project, FlyBase, the Mouse Genome Informatics group, and the Sanger Institute. They are a part of the Gene Ontology Project and their aim is to develop an ontology suitable for describing biological sequences.

ENZYME is a repository of information relative to the nomenclature of enzymes. It is primarily based on the recommendations of the Nomenclature Committee of the International Union of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (IUBMB) and it describes each type of characterized enzyme for which an EC (Enzyme Commission) number has been provided
Gene Ontology annotation uses evidence codes to indicate the type of evidence that supports the annotation.
The Gene Ontology (GO) project provides a controlled vocabulary to describe gene and gene product attributes in any organism.
The Non-Redundant Database (NRDB) of protein sequences in FASTA format from GenBank.
InterPro is a database of protein families, domains and functional sites in which identifiable features found in known proteins can be applied to unknown protein sequences.

Serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE) was applied to Giardia lamblia.

resource.pluginArgs: --contact @GiardiaSageTags.Contact@ --arrayDesignName 'Giardia SAGE Tags' --arrayDesignVersion '1.1' --studyName 'Characterization of the Giardia intestinalis Transcriptome' --studyDescription 'Giardia gene expression is being examined using Serial Analysis of Gene Expression to monitor genome-wide levels of messenger RNA (mRNA) expression throughout the Giardia life cycle. Examination of genome-wide gene expression patterns will provide a coherent picture of activation and inactivation of biological pathways. This research will provide a comprehensive understanding of changes in giardial gene expression in response to important host physiological signals and will serve as a valuable model for study of other parasites and complex eukaryotes, such as yeast and animals. It will provide a dynamic framework, in the context of the life cycle, to the annotation of the Giardia genome, including the detection of unpredicted genes via detection of their tags. ' --freqFile @downloadDir@/GiardiaSageTagFreqs/freqs.tsv
resource.description: Frequencies of SAGE tags that were observed in studies using RNA from Giardia lamblia life cycle

resource.extDbRlsDescrip: Mappings from epitope ids to external websites provided by IEDB.
resource.description: IEDB epitopes.

Phylogenetic profiles based on the presence or absence of known ORFs. Similarity between profiles is a good indicator of functional linkages between proteins (see Pellegrini et al., 1999). Data on ORFs with the most similar profiles to a given query ORF is also available, and can be used to establish the function of uncharacterized ORFs, based on the similarity of their profiles (see Date and Marcotte, 2003) with ORFs of known function.

resource.displayName: University of Washington Department of Bioengineering, experiment DTASelect-filter
resource.extDbRlsDescrip: Ratner proteomics experimental bands for experient DTASelect-filter

manualGet.institution: University of Washington Department of Bioengineering

resource.description:
WB (genome project strain) Giardia lamblia grown axenically in TYI-S-33 medium supplemented with bile salts. Adherent trophozoites were harvested during log-phase growth (60-70% confluent) and proteins extracted in 8M Urea and SDS. 1 mg of extracted protein was digested with sequencing-grade modified trypsin and fractionated via strong cation exchange chromatography into 90 fractions. Each fraction was run via C-18 reverse phase chromatography and analyzed using an LTQ ProteomeX ion trap mass spectrometer (Thermo Finnigan). Peptide assignments were made using SEQUEST, and the individual runs were compiled using DTASelect.

Daniel M. Ratner, Michael Lubrano, Martin Steffen, John Samuelson. University of Washington, Department of Bioengineering.

Protocol adapted from Jaffe, J.D., Berg, H.C, Church, G. M. Proteogenomic mapping as a complementary method to perform genome annotation. Proteomics, 2004, 4, 59-7

resource.unpack: cat /files/cbil/data/cbil/giardiaDB/manualDelivery/fromHilary/working_dir/contig_mapping.tab | perl -e 'while(<STDIN>){chomp;my ($old, $new)=split(/\t/,$_);$ids{$old} = $new;}; while(<>){if (/^(ctg02_\d+)/ and $ids{$1}){ my $temp=$1;$_ =~ s/$1/$ids{$temp}/g;print $_;}}' @downloadDir@/orfs_to_deprecated/orfs_to_deprecated_fixed.gff> @downloadDir@/orfs_to_deprecated_fixed/orfs_to_deprecated_final.gff
resource.pluginArgs: --extDbName %EXT_DB_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --seqExtDbName "G. lamblia contigs from Genbank" --seqExtDbRlsVer "2007-09-24" --mapFile @gusHome@/lib/xml/isf/GiardiaDB/giardiaDeprecatedGeneGffFeatures2Gus.xml --inputFileOrDir @downloadDir@/orfs_to_deprecated_fixed/orfs_to_deprecated_final.gff --fileFormat gff2 --soCvsVersion @soVer@ --defaultOrganism "Giardia lamblia ATCC 50803" --gff2GroupTag "GenePrediction" --naSequenceSubclass ExternalNASequence --seqIdColumn source_id --handlerExternalDbs "enzyme:enzymeDB:2008-02-06"

Concepts, definitions, terms, and resources for standardized description of a microarray experiment in support of MAGE v.1. The MGED ontology is divided into the MGED Core ontology which is intended to be stable and in synch with MAGE v.1; and the MGED Extended ontology which adds further associations and classes not found in MAGE v.1

Giardia lamblia microarray version 2 (provided by J. Craig Venter Institute free of charge). They are aminosilane surface coated glass slides with ss-oligo (70 mers) printed with a Genetix arraying machine. The array contains 19230 elements and covers the whole Giardia lamblia WB strain genome.

resource.displayName: RNA Abundance Database - Mage To RAD Importer
Stress Response in Giardia lamblia Trophozoites (Hehl Lab) - by temperature or varying DTT concentrations
resource.extDbName: Stress Response in Giardia lamblia Trophozoites (Hehl Lab)
resource.description: Giardia lamblia strain WBC6 (ATCC catalog No. 50803) trophozoites were grown in 11 ml TYI-S-33 medium supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum and bovine bile.Parasites were grown to confluency at 37 degrees C, and medium was replaced prior to stress induction. Redox stress was induced by addition of Dithiothreitol (DTT, Fluka 43817) for 30 minutes to final concentrations of 7.1 mM, 14.2 mM or 21.3 mM. In the control cultures an equivalent amount of water was used. Temperature stress (40 degrees C) was induced by incubating parasites for 30 minutes at 40 degrees C (control 37 degrees C).

resource.displayName: Stress Response in Giardia lamblia Trophozoites (Hehl Lab) - array data
resource.description: Giardia lamblia strain WBC6 (ATCC catalog No. 50803) trophozoites were grown in 11 ml TYI-S-33 medium supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum and bovine bile.Parasites were grown to confluency at 37 degrees C, and medium was replaced prior to stress induction. Redox stress was induced by addition of Dithiothreitol (DTT, Fluka 43817) for 30 minutes to final concentrations of 7.1 mM, 14.2 mM or 21.3 mM. In the control cultures an equivalent amount of water was used. Temperature stress (40 degrees C) was induced by incubating parasites for 30 minutes at 40 degrees C (control 37 degrees C).

resource.displayName: Stress Response in Giardia lamblia Trophozoites (Hehl Lab) - Expression Analysis
resource.description: Giardia lamblia strain WBC6 (ATCC catalog No. 50803) trophozoites were grown in 11 ml TYI-S-33 medium supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum and bovine bile.Parasites were grown to confluency at 37 degrees C, and medium was replaced prior to stress induction. Redox stress was induced by addition of Dithiothreitol (DTT, Fluka 43817) for 30 minutes to final concentrations of 7.1 mM, 14.2 mM or 21.3 mM. In the control cultures an equivalent amount of water was used. Temperature stress (40 degrees C) was induced by incubating parasites for 30 minutes at 40 degrees C (control 37 degrees C). This data was provided by the Hehl lab (C. Spycher, L. Morf) and the Functional Genomics Center Zurich (C. Aquino Fournier, H. Rehrauer, J. Sobek).

resource.description: Giardia lamblia strain WBC6 (ATCC catalog No. 50803) trophozoites were grown in 11 ml TYI-S-33 medium supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum and bovine bile.Parasites were grown to confluency at 37 degrees C, and medium was replaced prior to stress induction. Redox stress was induced by addition of Dithiothreitol (DTT, Fluka 43817) for 30 minutes, 60 minutes or 120 minutes to final concentrations of 14.2 mM. In the control cultures an equivalent amount of water was used.
